title: Definitions
context: §201M-1 Definitions. As used in this chapter, unless the context clearly requires otherwise: &ldquo;Advisory committee&rdquo; means an advisory committee on small business as established in section 201M-4. &ldquo;Affected small businesses&rdquo; or &ldquo;affects small business&rdquo; means any potential or actual requirement imposed upon a small business through an agency&rsquo;s proposed or adopted rule that will cause a direct and significant economic burden upon a small business, or is directly related to the formation, operation, or expansion of a small business. &ldquo;Agency&rdquo; means each state or county board, commission, department, or officer authorized by law to make rules, except those in the legislative or judicial branches. &ldquo;Board&rdquo; means the small business regulatory review board. &ldquo;Rule&rdquo; shall have the same meaning as in section 91-1. &ldquo;Small business&rdquo; means a for-profit enterprise consisting of fewer than one hundred full-time or part-time employees. [L 1998, c 168, pt of §2, §5; am L 2002, c 202, §§2, 5; am L 2007, c 217, §2]
